main event: A star-shaped object, the size of the sun, was observed in Ann Arbor, Michigan moving much faster than Sputnik before fading out like a meteor.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 4-5 seconds., The object was determined to be an astronomical meteor by observers., The object was white in color., Witnesses included a director at the University of Michigan Observatory., The sighting occurred on a night with hazy visibility, allowing for moon and stars to be seen.
witness description: Director at University of Michigan Observatory
